article:
{{Infobox Olympic event |event = Sailing |games = 1976 Summer |image =

'[[Sailing|Sailing/Yachting]]' is an Olympic sport starting from the Games of
the 1st Olympiad (1896 Olympics in Athens, Greece). With the exception of 1904
and possibly 1916, sailing was always a part of the Olympic program. The sailing
program of 1976 consisted of six sailing classes (disciplines). For each class,
seven races were scheduled from 19 July 1976 to 27 July 1976 off the coast of
Kingston, Ontario, on Lake Ontario. The sailing was done on the triangular-type
Olympic courses.
